summary: This is a confidential prosecution memorandum from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York seeking authorization to file a superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. It details new evidence from a victim, referred to as Minor Victim-4, who alleges sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 2001 to 2005, with Maxwell's involvement in recruitment, grooming, and scheduling. The memo proposes adding new charges of conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and sex trafficking of a minor. This is a prosecution memorandum from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated January 26, 2021, analyzing evidence related to a victim referred to as Minor Victim-4 (Jane Doe) and proposing expanded charges against Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the victim's testimony, corroborating evidence, and legal analysis for adding sex trafficking and extending conspiracy charges. This is a prosecution memorandum from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the status of discovery and Brady material, plans for seeking victim restitution, forfeiture considerations, victim coordination, and procedural matters including Maxwell's arrest and detention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution memo; charged with conspiracy, transportation, enticement, and perjury related to the sexual abuse of minor girls with Jeffrey Epstein. The memo details her alleged direct involvement in recruiting, grooming, and scheduling appointments for Minor Victim-4.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier; the primary perpetrator of the sexual abuse described. The memo details his sexual abuse of multiple minor victims, including Minor Victim-4, at his Palm Beach residence.

persons.name: Minor Victim-4
persons.context: A key victim whose allegations form the basis for the proposed new charges. She alleges being recruited at age 14, providing over 100 sexualized massages to Epstein from 2001-2005, and having multiple interactions with Maxwell.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: A victim referred to as Minor Victim-4. The document details her testimony about being recruited from Mar-a-Lago, massaging Epstein, receiving gifts, and being invited to travel. It also discusses inconsistencies in her statements and her trauma history.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Confirmed that Maxwell recruited Jane Doe from her job at Mar-a-Lago to massage Epstein.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who has excluded time under the Speedy Trial Act, setting a trial date of July 12, 2021.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorneys
persons.context: The authors/signatories of the prosecution memorandum, detailing the government's case preparation and legal strategies.

connections.description: Partners in a scheme to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls, as alleged in the prosecution memo. Maxwell is described as assisting Epstein in the 'pyramid scheme' of paid sexualized massages.
Maxwell allegedly recruited, groomed, scheduled appointments for, and interacted with Minor Victim-4 as part of the scheme to abuse her for Epstein.
Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused Minor Victim-4 during massages at his Palm Beach residence over 100 times between 2001 and 2005.
Maxwell allegedly recruited Jane Doe, called to schedule massage appointments, saw her nude, touched her breasts, discussed sexual topics, and facilitated her abuse by Epstein.
Epstein sexually abused Jane Doe, paid her for massages and nude photos, invited her to travel, and sent her gifts from New York.
Alessi worked for Epstein and confirmed Maxwell's role in recruiting Jane Doe.
The prosecutors are building the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, managing discovery, and planning for trial, restitution, and potential forfeiture.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case, having set the trial schedule and excluded time under the Speedy Trial Act.

events.title: Recruitment of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Minor Victim-4, approximately 14 years old, is recruited by an associate to provide massages for Jeffrey Epstein at his Palm Beach residence.

events.title: Period of Abuse of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Minor Victim-4 provides over 100 sexualized massages to Jeffrey Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, during which she was sexually abused. The abuse continued intermittently until she was 18.

events.title: Maxwell's Civil Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave a civil deposition during which she made false statements, leading to perjury charges.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrest on Original Indictment
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on the original six-count indictment, which prompted Minor Victim-4 to come forward for an interview.

events.title: Prosecution Memo for Superseding Indictment
events.description: Prosecutors seek authorization to file a superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell based on new evidence from Minor Victim-4, proposing new sex trafficking charges.

events.title: First FBI Interview of Jane Doe
events.description: Jane Doe was first interviewed by the FBI. She described being introduced to Epstein, massaging him approximately 100 times, telling him her age, receiving gifts, being paid $500 for nude photos, and receiving sexualized massages. She did not mention Maxwell.

events.title: Civil Deposition of Jane Doe
events.description: Jane Doe was deposed as part of a civil lawsuit against Epstein. She testified that Maxwell and Epstein were the two people who called to schedule appointments. She also lied about engaging in sex acts while working for an escort service.

events.title: Epstein Settles Civil Suit with Jane Doe
events.description: Epstein settled the civil lawsuit with Jane Doe just a few days after her deposition.

events.title: FBI Re-interviews Jane Doe
events.description: The FBI re-interviewed Jane Doe in 2020. During these interviews, she provided detailed information about Maxwell's involvement, admitted to lying in her 2009 deposition about escort work, and explained why she previously omitted details about Maxwell.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Palm Beach Residence
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's Palm Beach residence, recovering a massage table and sex toys with labels indicating manufacture outside Florida.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and taken into custody.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Commencement
events.description: Trial in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin.

events.title: Prosecution Memorandum Prepared
events.description: This internal prosecution memorandum detailing case status, discovery, and legal strategies was finalized.

locations: USAO-SDNY (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
USAO-SDFL (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida)
keyFacts: The prosecution seeks to add new charges against Ghislaine Maxwell for conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and sex trafficking of a minor, based on the allegations of 'Minor Victim-4'.

Minor Victim-4 alleges being sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein over 100 times at his Palm Beach residence from approximately age 14 to 18 (2001-2005), with Ghislaine Maxwell involved in her recruitment and grooming.

Corroborating evidence includes witness testimony, message pads from Epstein's home with the victim's name/phone number (2003-2005), and a 2002 FedEx invoice for a package sent from Epstein's Manhattan address to the victim's home.

The memo details Maxwell's specific alleged actions: scheduling appointments, asking for contact numbers, inquiring about the victim's sexual history, complimenting her nude body, and asking her to travel with them.
The victim stated she used the money from Epstein to buy drugs, became addicted, and that her drug use was partly to numb the pain of the abuse.
Phone records from 2004 confirm communication between Jane Doe and Jeffrey Epstein on at least two occasions during her minority.
Juan Alessi confirmed that Ghislaine Maxwell recruited Jane Doe from her job at Mar-a-Lago to massage Epstein.
Flight records confirm Jane Doe traveled with Epstein and Maxwell when she was 17 years old.
Jane Doe admitted to lying under oath during her 2009 civil deposition about engaging in sex acts while working for an escort service.
The prosecution proposes expanding charges against Maxwell to include sex trafficking (2001-2004) and extending conspiracy charges through 2004, based on Jane Doe's testimony.

The prosecution has reviewed files from multiple agencies (SDNY, FBI, PBPD, PBSA) for discovery and Brady obligations and produced most materials to the defense, with a court-authorized delay for a subset related to victims not named in the indictment.

The government expects to seek mandatory restitution for victims under the Trafficking Victims Protection Act (TVPA) to cover a wide range of losses, including medical, therapeutic, housing, and legal costs.

Forfeiture of properties involved in the offense conduct is complicated because none belonged to Ghislaine Maxwell, requiring consultation with the Money Laundering and Asset Forfeiture Section (MLAF).
Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, has been detained since, and is held at the MDC; her trial is scheduled for July 12, 2021, with Speedy Trial Act time excluded by Judge Nathan.
The case involves multiple victim-witnesses who have been entered into the Victim Notification System and connected with FBI victim specialists, indicating a victim-centered prosecution approach.
